statement.tex: \text{Find the integral of the function}\\ \dfrac{\cos 2 x+2\sin^2 x}{\cos^ 2 x} \,

step.context: \text{The following substitution would convert}\\ f(x) = \dfrac{\cos 2 x+2\sin^2 x}{\cos^ 2 x} \text{ to the more easily}\\ \text{integrable form } \sec^2 x \text{ or } \mathrm{cosec}^2 x
\text{Is the following evaluation of the integral}\\ I = \int \dfrac{\cos 2 x+2\sin^2 x}{\cos^ 2 x} \, dx \quad \text{correct}?
step.tex:
\begin{align} I = \int f(x) \, dx &=
\int \dfrac{\cos 2 x+2\sin^2 x}{\cos^ 2 x} \, dx \\ &= \int \sec^2 x \, dx \\ &= \tan x+C \end{align}

\begin{align} I = \int f(x) \, dx &=
\int \dfrac{\cos 2 x+2\sin^2 x}{\cos^ 2 x} \, dx \\ &= \int \sec^2 x \, dx \\ &= \tan^2 x+C \end{align}
step.reason: \int \sec^2 (a x) \,dx = \dfrac{\tan (a x)}{a}+ C \\ \text{where C is the constant of integration.}
